disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when my frustration with individual Catholics led me to view them, or our shared faith community, in a negative light?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally skip a sacred day, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I verbally despise the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: to their utility for me , rather than treating them with the dignity and respect due to them
lust.question: Did I reduce others, particularly those who are important in my life, to their utility for me, rather than treating them with the dignity and respect due to them?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my exercise routine, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?

extracted_data_phrases: of others ' blessings , which I keep hidden even from those closest to me
even from those closest to me
envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' blessings, which I keep hidden even from those closest to me?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in public places, using vulgar language that was unbecoming of a Christian?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with impolite language, thereby violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and use language that was hurtful to others in your words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to worldly pleasures and neglect of temperance
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, demonstrating an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures and neglect of temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking, neglecting to balance my physical pleasures with temperance and self-control?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: for myself and those in need
prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my financial responsibilities, potentially harming my ability to provide for myself and those in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over providing for my family 's needs
prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful spending to take precedence over providing for my family's needs, potentially harming their well-being?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in order to prioritize other pursuits or pleasures
prodigality.question: Have I excessively and wastefully used money that is needed for family responsibilities, in order to prioritize other pursuits or pleasures?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing private affairs or faults of others
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing private affairs or faults of others, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I entertained myself by discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my heart, rather than seeking peace with those who have wronged me?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
